titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Lynn Townsend White papers, 1937-1985 LSC.1541
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Caroline Cubé, 1998.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

p.subject: History --Medieval History
History --History, University ofCalifornia --History, UC Los Angeles
Geographical (By Place) --University of California --University ofCalifornia Los Angeles

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-27 13:21:07 -0700.

did.abstract: Lynn Townsend White, Jr. (1907- ) was a professor of history at UCLA (1958-72), and Director of the UCLA Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies (1964-70). The collection consists of teaching and research material related to Lynn White's career as a history professor.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lynn Townsend White Papers (Collection 1541). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lynn Townsend White, Jr. was born in San Francisco, California, April 29, 1907; BA, Stanford University (1928), MA, Union Theological Seminary (1929), Harvard University (1930), Ph.D, Harvard University (1934); history instructor, Princeton University (1933-37); assistant professor (1937-40) and professor (1940-43) of history at Stanford University; President, Mills College (1943-58); professor of history, UCLA (1958-72); Director of the UCLA Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies (1964-70); recipient of numerous honorary degrees, awards and decorations; various publications include: Educating our daughters: a challenge to the colleges (1950), Frontiers of knowledge in the study of man (1956), Medieval technology and social change (1962), Medieval religion and technology (1978).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of teaching and research material related to the career of history professor Lynn White. Includes exams, lecture notes, publications, correspondence, manuscripts, bibliographic files, and photographs for publications.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Teaching materials (Boxes 1-4).
Research materials and publications (Boxes 5-11).
Correspondence files (Boxes 12-15).
Bibliographical files (Boxes 16-22).
Photographs used in Lynn White's publications (Boxes 23-24).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Technology, History, Democracy [oral history transcript] / Lynn Townsend White, interviewee. UCLA Oral History Department interview, 1983. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.
